definition: to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
the author takes sole responsibility for the views expressed here (disclaimer)

sentences.english: And Lin Bicheng exorbitant is conceited, meet with repeatedly setback.
sentences.chinese: 而林必成过分的自负，屡遭挫折。

sentences.english: The conceited man, always can't help crowing in a swoop.
sentences.chinese: 那些自负的人嘛，总会不由地鸡鸣于鹤群之中。

sentences.english: His colleagues dislike him because of his excessive grandness .
sentences.chinese: 由于他过度地自负，同僚们不喜欢他。

sentences.english: Yes, he is a gigantic egotistical overrated artist.
sentences.chinese: 没错，他是一个极度自负的却被高估的演员。

sentences.english: For many young people their ego, or over-confidence, could be their Achilles' heel.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人的弱点也许是自负，过于的自信。

sentences.english: Self-conceit has set measures to his progress.
The egoism of an artist sometimes seems natural.
sentences.chinese: 艺术家的自负有时啃垧来是自然的。

sentences.english: It is very vainglorious of you to think that the truth is on your side.
sentences.chinese: 你以为真理在你的一方，实在太过自负了。

sentences.english: One with harmonious spirit is far from being pretentious and conceited.
sentences.chinese: 怡悦的精神，在于不矫饰自负。

sentences.english: The fee is low, compared with that at many other in dependent schools.
sentences.chinese: 与其他自负盈亏的学校比较，这里的学费是低的。

sentences.english: And the Machine was crufty and bodacious, existing in theory only.
sentences.chinese: 而这些混沌自负的机器只存在于理论中。

sentences.english: Violators Will Be Citied or Towed Away at Vehicle Owner's Expense.
sentences.chinese: 占用者将被罚或被拖车并需自负拖车费。

sentences.english: He also has anegotistical, sociopathic attitude.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度也是自负和反社会的。

sentences.english: I’m a typical Leo. I’m faithful but patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 我就是典型的狮子座，忠诚却又自负。

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
